Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) is an interface to the Java programming language that defines a standard way for a client application to access a database. JDBC provides the methods needed for querying and updating data. JDBC is aimed at using relational databases. Java 2 Standard Edition version 1.4 (J2SE) includes version 3.0 of the JDBC interface, as well as a model implementation of the JDBC-ODBC bridge. The bridge provides a connection to data sources that provide an ODBC interface from the Java virtual machine. This bridge is a closed native code (no Java), and is only suitable for experimental use or situations where no other driver is available. The JDBC-ODBC bridge provides only some of the functionality of the JDBC 3.0 interface.

The Synoikia (, also ) () was a festival in ancient Athens dedicated to Athena. It was then that Theseus' unification of the villages of Attica () into the city of Athens was remembered. The festival was celebrated on the 16th of the month of Hekatombaion, i.e. around the current July-August. According to Athenian tradition, the festival was founded by Theseus himself. It was dedicated to Athena as the protector of Athens and all of united Attica. The celebration also honored Zeus Fratrio. In addition, during that time, a bloodless sacrifice was offered to Eirene, the personification of peace. Thucydides and Plutarch mention the festival, meaning it still existed in their time. Synoikismos (, "living together") in ancient Greece meant the establishment of a new city or polis, or city-state, by combining a number of earlier settlements into a new city and establishing a new urban center for it. The combined settlements could be villages or earlier polises that became subordinate to the new polis. Sometimes unification was a purely political measure and did not change the structure of the settlement, while sometimes it even involved population transfers. Sometimes the term "sympoliteia" has been used in the same sense.

split_passages_en: Dendrology (from the Greek words "dendron" 'tree' and "logos" 'teaching'), i.e. tree science, means the study of woody plants. Dendrology defines, describes and classifies woody plants and studies their biological properties. Plants with woody stems are, for example, trees, shrubs, ferns and lianas. They do not form a taxonomically coherent group, and therefore are not necessarily closely related to each other. Many plant genera have both woody and herbaceous species, and many include only a few woody species.

Dendrology is a branch of biology that studies trees and other woody plants, such as lianas and shrubs. This branch is mainly studied in the field of botany and its application, forestry. In this science, morphology and anatomy are mainly studied to obtain the basics of tree recognition. In addition, physiology and ecology are also the main focus in this field. Various methods form a number of typical dendrological methods, such as age estimation through the circle of years, species determination based on bark pattern and fruit and seed shape).

Ornithology, or bird science, is a branch of biology that studies birds. Ornithology includes, among other things, the observation of the lifestyles, song, flight patterns and structure of birds, as well as the classification of birds. Often all bird watchers or bird enthusiasts are called ornithologists, although only a few of them are actual ornithologists, ornithologists. Ornithology is carried out in Finland, especially in the biology departments of the universities of Helsinki and Turku. Much ornithological research is simply based on direct observations. However, ornithologists have also adopted many devices and techniques that facilitate research. Ringing has been used as early as the beginning of the 19th century, and it has helped to gain information about the lifespan and movements of birds. Every year, hundreds of thousands of birds around the world are ringed. The movements of birds can also be monitored using probes or radio transmitters.

Dendrologie is a book with botanical illustrations and descriptions that was written by the German botanist and pteridologist Karl Heinrich Emil Koch. It was published in two volumes with three parts in the years 1869 to 1873, under the name "Dendrologie. Bäume, Sträucher und Halbsträucher, welche in Mittel- und Nord-Europa im Freien kultivirt werden. Kritisch beleuchtet von Karl Koch. Erlangen".

Limnology studies inland waters: freshwater and saltwater lakes, ponds and rivers; especially the relationships and interactions between living nature and its environment. The word "limnology" comes from the Greek words Λίμνη (limne) meaning lake and λόγος (logos) meaning knowledge. The most important basic sciences supporting limnology research and studies are hydrology, geology, microbiology, botany, zoology, physics and chemistry. Limnology's sister sciences are hydrobiology and fisheries science. Seas, on the other hand, are studied by marine science, or oceanography. Limnologists work, for example, at the Finnish Environmental Center and regional environmental centers, water protection associations, municipal environmental secretaries and researchers at universities and research institutes. Limnology is taught at the University of Helsinki's Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Bio and Environmental Sciences, where students major in "Aquatic Sciences", and at the University of Jyväskylä's Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences. As a soil type, moraine is the most common soil type in Finland, and it covers almost the entire bedrock of Finland. Moraine accounts for approximately 48% of Finland's land area. Moraines are so-called "undifferentiated" soil types, i.e. they contain several soil types mixed with each other, from large boulders to the finest clay. There is some variation in the classification of moraine species, but most commonly the division is made according to the most abundant variety; we are talking about gravel, sand or silt moraine, depending on which type is the most dominant in the moraine. Prevalence of moraine species in Finland: The thickness of moraine deposits in the southern parts of Finland is usually 2–3 meters. De Geer moraines are wave-like narrow moraine ridges that can form extensive fields of tens or even hundreds of ridges. In an aerial view, they resemble an old-time washing board. Tens or even hundreds of meters long ridges were created during the Ice Age by the influence of the glacier. The glacier carried with it the moraine it had ground from the rock. The De Geer moraines were created when the glacier ended up in shallow water, right at the glacier's floating limit in a fairly high area of ​​the terrain. split_passages_en: In cultural research, the concept of pre-modernity compares modern society with the one before it. A star cluster is a group of stars held together by gravity. There are two types of star clusters: open and globular. The open cluster is a relatively young, loose association of stars. Typically, an open cluster has a few tens of stars, in the largest several hundreds. On the other hand, an open cluster can be a group formed by only a few stars. With age, the open cluster begins to disintegrate into interstellar space, but its stars continue to travel in almost the same direction for a very long time. Such groups are called a mobile group. A globular cluster is usually a dense cluster of hundreds of thousands of stars, and is remarkably old.

passage_in_language: <0> Abū Abd Allāh Muhammad ibn Alī ibn Muhammad ibn Arabī al-Hātimī at-Tāī (), s. 1165, Murcia, Espanja – k. 1240, Damaskos) on yksi suufilaisen filosofian kuuluisimmista edustajista. Vasta viime vuosina hänet on alettu Euroopassa laskea suurten islamilaisten filosofien joukkoon. Ibn Arabin ensimmäiset teokset julkaistiin Euroopassa noin 150 vuotta sitten. Ibn Arabin kaksi pääteosta ovat "Viisauden sinettikivet" ("Fusus al-hikam") ja "Mekkalaisia ilmestyksiä" ("al-Futuhat al-makkiyya"). Ibn Arabi edustaa suufilaista filosofiaa. Suufilaisuus erosi n. 700-luvun lopulla šiialaisudesta erilliseksi liikkeeksi. Suufilainen filosofia "(irfan)" pohjauu Koraanin tulkintaan, mutta sisältää paljon gnostilaisia ja uusplatonistisia vaikutteita. Kannattajien mukaan suufilaisuus on islaminuskon syvällisin tulkinta, vastustajien mielestä se on <1> kreikkalaisesta filosofiasta ja vieraista uskonnoista vaikutteita saanut harhaoppi. Ibn Arabi syntyi Espanjassa, Murciassa vuonna 1165 ja kuoli Damaskoksessa 1240. Ibn Arabin nimen eteen lisätään usein etuliite "Muhyildin" (محيي الدين), joka tarkoittaa "uskonnon elävöittäjää". Suufit käyttävät hänestä myös lisänimeä "suurin mestari", "al-šaikh al-akbar" (الشيخ الأكبر). Länsimaissa filosofi on tunnettu paremmin tästä käännetyllä nimellä "doctor maximus", "suurin opettaja". Filosofin Damaskoksessa sijaitseva hauta on edelleen suufilaisille tärkeä pyhiinvaelluspaikka. Ibn Arabin elämän merkittävimpiä tapahtumia oli hänen pyhiinvaelluksensa Mekkaan, jossa hän koki oman kertomuksensa mukaan vahvan mystisen elämyksen. Kertomuksensa mukaan ibn Arabi näki vahvan uskonnollisen näyn, jossa hän tapasi profeetta Muhammedin. Ibn Arabi viipyi Mekassa <2> ibn Arabia yhdeksi aikansa suurimmista ajattelijoista. Ibn Arabi tulkitsi islamilaista uskontunnustusta "La ilaha illa Allah" siten, että Allah on kaikki ja kaikki on Allah; että ainoa olevainen on Allah. Tämä oli eräiden islamtulkitsijoiden mukaan panteismia eli kaikkijumalaista uskoa siihen, että Allah ja kaikki maailmankaikkeudessa ovat yhtä. Ibn Arabi piti ajattelunsa yhtenä päätehtävänä rakentaa siltaa eri uskontojen ja filosofisten ajatussuuntausten välille. Ibn Arabin ajattelu sai huomattavan määrän vaikutteita platonistisesta, kreikkalaisesta filosofiasta. Useat hänen teoksensa käsittelevät uskontojen moneutta ja suvaitsevaisuutta. Mystistä suufilaisuutta voidaan pitää keskiajan suvaitsevaisimpana uskontona. Lasitettu tiili on islamin taiteessa ollut käytössä rakennusten koristelussa abbasididynastian ajoista saakka (750–1258). Iranissa tiilikoristelu on kehittynyt hyvin hienoksi tekniikaksi. "Tuhat ja yksi yötä", "Tuhannen ja yhden yön tarinat" on tunnetuimpia arabialaisia kertomuksia, jonka persiasta arabiaksi käännetty versio 900-luvulta on nimeltään "Hezär afsäneh, Tuhat kertomusta". Persian kirjallisuuden tunnetuimpia runoilijoita on Omar Khaijam. Islamin taide on vaikuttanut voimakkaasti varsinkin Espanjan rakennustaiteeseen. Scandinavian ancient faith is the name for the religion practiced by the people of Scandinavia in pre-Christian times. It is thought that the picture fields carved into the rocks were centers of religious practice. The Scandinavian Bronze Age (around 1700–500 BC) is an era in Scandinavian prehistory, whose heyday is at the end of the Bronze Ages that prevailed in Central Europe. It was preceded by the Neolithic Stone Age and followed by the Pre-Roman Iron Age. The Scandinavian Bronze Age consisted of core areas located in the areas of present-day Denmark, northern Germany, southern Sweden and the southern coastal region of Norway. Some researchers also include the regions of northern Norway, the coastal regions of northern Sweden on the west side of the Baltic Sea, and regions east of the Baltic Sea, such as Åland, the coastal region of southwestern Finland, the coast of northern Estonia and its large islands, to its cultural circle. Estimates of the number of Afro-Bolivians vary between 6,000 and 158,000. The World Factbook published by the CIA estimates that Afro-Bolivians make up 1% of the entire Bolivian population. The large jumps between estimates are due to the fact that Bolivian censuses do not take into account different races. The largest concentrations of Afro-Bolivians are in the department of La Paz in the provinces of Nor Yungas and Sud Yungas. The Multinational State of Bolivia () or Bolivia (, Aymara "Wuliwya") is a republic inland in South America. Its border neighbors are Brazil to the north and east, Paraguay, Argentina and Chile to the south, and Peru to the west. The plant and animal species of Bolivia, located in the Amazon basin, are among the most abundant in the world. With just under ten million inhabitants, Bolivia is the fifth largest South American country. Bolivia is named after the Venezuelan revolutionary leader Simón Bolívar. The history of the country's independence has been marked by a couple of hundred coups. Many presidential elections have ended with the military ousting the winner. Liner and cruise ship traffic is operated especially from Laukontori beach and Mustalahti harbor. In 2015, the port of Tampere was the busiest inland port in Finland in terms of passenger numbers (71,750). A partial explanation for the high number of passengers can be found in the summer traffic to Viikinsaari in Pyhäjärvi, where people travel, for example, to an excursion or to various cultural events such as to see the summer theater. Domestic passenger and connecting vessel traffic was busier than Tampere in the Finnish maritime area in the Capital Region, between mainland Finland and Åland, in the Åland archipelago and in the Archipelago Sea.

and the modernization of the Naistenlahti facility. In addition to Tampere, Tampereen Vesi manages water for Pirkkala. Almost all surface water comes from Roine. In addition, Tampereen Vede has four surface water plants in Näsijärvi and five groundwater abstractions. Tampereen Vesi is responsible for 96 percent of Tampere, Kangasala, Pirkkala and Ylöjärvi waste water. In 2012, a total of 31.9 million cubic meters of wastewater was treated in Tampere. More than 75 percent of wastewater is treated at the Viinikanalhti treatment plant. Tampere Water has five water towers and an upper water tank. Petsamo has an old and a new water tower. The other water towers are from Hervanna

Tampere () is a Finnish city and the provincial center of Pirkanmaa, located on the shores of Lake Näsijärvi and Lake Pyhäjärvi. Tampere is Finland's third largest municipality in terms of population and, with neighboring municipalities, Finland's second largest urban area. Tampere is also the largest inland city in the Nordic countries in terms of population. The population of the city of Tampere is 330,711 inhabitants of the central city of Tampere. The central part of Tampere's downtown area is located in the lake and ridge area on the isthmus between Näsijärvi and Pyhäjärvi, through which the Tammerkoski flows from Näsijärvi to Pyhäjärvi. Tammerkoski's fall height is 18 meters. The red brick factory buildings visible on its shores tell of Tampere's industrial history. Historically, Tampere is Finland's first and largest industrial city. Tammerkoski's rapids landscape has been named one of Finland's national landscapes. Gustav III founded Tampere in 1779, but the city began to grow

Geographically, Tampere has many surface formations. North of the center is Pirkanmaa's largest central lake Näsijärvi. To the south of it is Pyhäjärvi, and between them Tammerkoski, dammed through the center, flows. There are also ridge landscapes in the center, as the ridge section starting from Salpausela continues in Tampere, e.g. as Pyynik ridge. Tampere belongs to the southern boreal region of the coniferous forest zone. The most common type of forest in the area is a thicket growing from blueberries and spruce, and the most common tree in the natural forest is spruce. Pine grows abundantly where spruce does not thrive. Hardwoods also grow in the natural forest. Tampere has 11 protected areas under the Nature Conservation Act, the largest of which is the Teisko Vattula nature reserve, which is the largest in Tampere. Tampere's emblematic species is the wagtail among birds, the dark web butterfly among animals and the violet among plants. The total area of ​​Tampere is km²,

According to Professor Kirsi Vähäkanka, silver is not a trace element. Humans don't need it, it's poisonous. If consumed in abundance, silver water causes silver poisoning, argyria. In it, silver accumulates as silver selenide and silver sulfide, especially in the connective tissue of the dermis, and is permanently stored in the cells. Argyria is characterized by a permanent bluish-gray discoloration of the skin and sometimes also the internal organs. The change is usually most visible in areas of the skin exposed to sunlight. Swedish toxicologist Hanna Karlsson has studied the effect of silver water on lung tissues and found that it destroys the cells' DNA. When inhaled, silver particles cause inflammation in the lungs. split_passages_en: Shiva (often Šiva, Devanagari: शिव, IAST: "Śiva") is the creator and destroyer god of the Hindu trinity of gods (Brahma is the creator god, Vishnu the sustainer). Shiva is worshiped by the Shaivite branch of Hinduism. Shiva is depicted in many figures, but is often worshiped in an abstract form: the object of worship is the "linga", a phallic symbol represented by a stone slab, standing on top of the "yoni", the feminine principle (or power). The most important symbol of Shiva is the trident, which represents the three levels of being and the trinity gods Brahma, Vishnu and Rudra (which is often, somewhat misleadingly, also identified directly with Shiva). Shiva also often wears an ascetic's knot and a blue neck, and is accompanied by a bull. Shiva often holds a narrow drum, which, in addition to rhythm and dance, represents the creation of the world

Vishnu (Hindi विष्‍णु, IAST: "Viṣṇu") is the love and life-sustaining god of the Hindu trinity of divinity (Brahma is the creator god and Shiva is the destroyer and re-creator). Vishnu is also known as Narayana. Vishnu and his incarnations are worshiped by the Vaishnaean (Vishnuism) branch of Hinduism. It is one of the main trends in Hinduism. Vishnu is often depicted as four-armed and blue. His emblems are a disc-shaped "chakra"/"chakram" and a conch. Vishnu's consort is Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth, light and knowledge. The religious practices of the Vishnu people are called Bhakti. The word is derived from the root 'bhaj' and means 'to worship'. The neo-Hindu Krishna movement is the best known of the traditions that worship incarnations of Vishnu in Western countries. Krishna is the eighth incarnation of Vishnu. According to Hinduism, Vishnu has appeared on earth

and is a metaphor for artistry. Shiva is often depicted as dancing, and is considered the lord of cosmic dance or yoga. One of Shiva's forms is a god who is half male and half female. Shiva is behind all (God) manifestations - pure consciousness that is either "outward" or "inward." This is why he is described as having a "third eye" half closed, for when he opens it, the universe is destroyed. According to the story, Shiva's consort Parvati sneaked up behind Shiva's back and placed her hands in front of his eyes. Darkness spread over the earth when the god had closed his eyes. Therefore, a flame blazed from Shiva's forehead, behind which the third eye was revealed. The third eye brought light back to earth. of Shiva

the consort and her feminine energy is Parvati, whose evil-warring form is called Durga. Born from the mouth of Durga, the furious manifestation is Kali, who represents the power of the universe unleashed in full force, ready to kill all ignorance. The son of Shiva and Parvati is the well-known elephant-headed Ganesha. It is said that Shiva does not incarnate as an avatara because he is beyond everything. Instead, her feminine side or principle incarnates in the form of, for example, "Devi". Rama, the incarnation of "Vishnu", on the other hand, worshiped Shiva. Shiva is both creator, sustainer and destroyer. According to Shaivism, all Hindu gods and goddesses are part of Shiva. Shiva has five roles: Of these, the role of the benefactor is considered the most significant.

query: Onko nolla itse positiivinen tai negatiivinen?
passage_in_language: <0> lukuihin liittyviä ominaisuuksia vapaasti suomennettuna: "Nollan ja negatiivisen luvun summa on negatiivinen. Nollan ja positiivisen luvun summa on positiivinen. Kahden nollan summa on nolla. Positiivisen ja negatiivisen luvun summa on lukujen erotus tai nolla, jos ne ovat yhtä suuret. Positiivien- tai negatiivisen luvun jakolaskun tulos, kun nolla on jakajana, on murtoluku, jossa nolla on jakaja. Nolla jaettuna positiivisella tai negatiivisella luvulla on nolla tai murtoluku, jossa osoittajana on nolla ja nimittäjänä on mainittu luku. Nolla jaettuna nollalla on nolla." Viimeinen lause, jossa nolla jaetaan nollalla, ei vastaa nykykäsitystä laskun tuloksesta. Nykyisen Pakistanin alueelta Bakhshalin kylästä on löytynyt nollia sisältävä käsikirjoitus. <1> siten, että lasketaan yhteen 4 tuhatta, 2 sataa ja 6. Kymmeniä ei luvun muodostamiseen tarvita, joten niiden lukumäärää merkitään nollalla. Monissa muinaisissa paikkamerkintää käyttävissä lukujärjestelmissä ei nollaa aina käytetty. Muun muassa babylonialaiset luvut kirjoitettiin jättämällä tyhjä paikka puuttuvalle kertoimelle. Luonnollisen luvun määritelmässä ei oteta nollaa aina mukaan, mutta joskus näin tehdään. Nolla on suurin ei-positiivinen luku ja pienin ei-negatiivinen luku. Nolla itse ei ole positiivinen eikä negatiivinen. Nolla on parillinen luku. Nolla on myös ainoa luku, joka on sekä reaaliluku että imaginaariluku, koska formula_1. Yhteenlaskussa toinen operandi voi olla nolla. Nolla ei vaikuta summaan, joka saa toisen operandin arvon. Nollaa <2> ohjelman keskeytymisen tai siirtymisen poikkeuskäsittelijään. Liukuluvuilla laskettaessa (hallitsevan IEEE 754 -standardin mukaan) nollia on kaksi: positiivinen nolla ja negatiivinen nolla; näiden voi ajatella kuvaavan esitystarkkuuden rajaa pienempiä lukuja, joista kuitenkin tiedetään etumerkki. Nollalla jakaminen antaa tulokseksi positiivisen äärettömän tai negatiivisen äärettömän riippuen jaettavan ja nollajakajan etumerkeistä. Jos myös jaettava on nolla eli jaetaan nollaa nollalla, tulos on määrittelemätön arvo, jota kutsutaan nimellä Not-a-Number tai lyhenteellä NaN (vakiintumaton suomennos 'epäluku'). <3> −0 (negatiivinen nolla tai miinusnolla) on joissakin yhteyksissä käytettävä esitys nollalle. Luku 0 ei matemaattisessa mielessä ole positiivinen tai negatiivinen luku, mutta tietyissä tilanteissa nollankin yhteydessä etumerkkejä käytetään. Tietokoneohjelmoinnissa IEEE 754 -liukulukustandardissa negatiivinen nolla kuvataan binääriluvulla, jonka etumerkkibitti on yksi ja kaikki muut bitit nollia. Tietotekniikassa negatiivista nollaa käytetään joskus esimerkiksi tilanteissa, jossa nollaa pienempi luku pyöristetään nollaksi, tai jos laskennan yhteydessä tapahtuu aritmeettinen alivuoto. Meteorologiassa miinusnollaa käytetään sääennusteiden yhteydessä, ilmoitettaessa lähellä nollaa, mutta sen alapuolella, olevat lämpötilat. Tämä on käyttökelpoista erityisesti Celsiusasteikon yhteydessä, koska vesi jäätyy nollan alapuolella ja sulaa nollan yläpuolella.
split_passages_en: properties related to numbers freely translated: "The sum of a zero and a negative number is negative. The sum of a zero and a positive number is positive. The sum of two zeros is zero. The sum of a positive and a negative number is the difference of the numbers or zero if they are equal. the result of dividing a number when zero is the divisor is a fraction with zero as the divisor. Zero divided by a positive or negative number is zero or a fraction with zero as the numerator and the mentioned number as the denominator. Zero divided by zero is zero." The last sentence, where zero is divided by zero, does not correspond to the current understanding of the result of a calculation. A manuscript containing zeros has been found in the village of Bakhshal in the area of ​​present-day Pakistan.

in such a way that 4 thousand, 2 hundred and 6 are added together. Tens are not needed to form a number, so their number is marked with zero. In many ancient number systems using place notation, zero was not always used. For example, Babylonian numbers were written by leaving a blank space for the missing coefficient. Zero is not always included in the definition of a natural number, but sometimes it is. Zero is the largest non-positive number and the smallest non-negative number. Zero itself is neither positive nor negative. Zero is an even number. Zero is also the only number that is both a real number and an imaginary number because formula_1. In addition, the second operand can be zero. Zero does not affect the sum that gets the value of the second operand. Reset

to the exception handler of program interruption or transition. When calculating with floating-point numbers (according to the prevailing IEEE 754 standard), there are two zeros: positive zero and negative zero; these can be thought of as describing numbers smaller than the limit of representation accuracy, but whose sign is known. Dividing by zero results in positive infinity or negative infinity, depending on the signs of the divisor and the zero divisor. If zero is also to be divided, i.e. zero is divided by zero, the result is an undefined value, which is called Not-a-Number or abbreviated NaN.

−0 (negative zero or minus zero) is a representation of zero used in some contexts. In the mathematical sense, the number 0 is not a positive or negative number, but in certain situations even in connection with zero, signs are used. In computer programming, in the IEEE 754 floating-point standard, a negative zero is represented by a binary number whose sign bit is one and all other bits are zero. In information technology, negative zero is sometimes used, for example, in situations where a number smaller than zero is rounded to zero, or if an arithmetic underflow occurs during a calculation. In meteorology, minus zero is used in connection with weather forecasts, when indicating temperatures close to zero, but below it. This is especially useful with the Celsius scale, because water freezes below zero and melts above zero.

Purimin viettoon kuuluu Esterin kirjan lukeminen synagogassa kaksi kertaa sekä lahjojen antaminen köyhille. Sen jälkeen vietetään purim-juhlaa, jota varten pukeudutaan usein naamiaisasuihin. Purim ei ole yhtä tärkeä juhla kuin Tooran määrittelemät pyhäpäivät. Siksi työnteko on yleensä sallittu. Varsinkin 1930-luvulta lähtien juhlinta siirtyi yhä enemmän vapunpäivästä sitä edeltävään päivään. split_passages_en: Purim (, "divination") is a Jewish holiday commemorating the salvation of the Persian Jews from a plot by Haman, King Xerxes' adviser, to destroy them. The events are described in the book of Esther of the Old Testament. Purim is celebrated on the 14th of the month of Adar. Purim is a very happy holiday, when you are allowed to have fun. Celebrating Purim includes reading the book of Esther twice in the synagogue and giving gifts to the poor. After that, the Purim party is celebrated, for which people often dress up in fancy dress. Purim is not as important a holiday as the holy days defined by the Torah. Therefore, work is usually allowed. Ester is a Jewish young woman who, thanks to her beauty, gets to be King Xerxes, that is, Ahasuerus's beloved wife and queen. The king is not aware of Esther

there are two adar months. In this case, Purim is celebrated in the second month of Adar. The corresponding day of the first month of Adar is called "purim katan", little purim. Many Jewish communities also have local Purim celebrations to celebrate the victory over an anti-Semitic group or ruler. In Frankfurt, such a celebration is called "Purim Vintz". Even families may have their own "purims" to commemorate being saved from a difficult situation, persecution or accident.

as a spring festival, to mark the arrival of spring. "The only difficulty in celebrating May Day as a spring celebration has been the artificiality of the matter: after all, spring will not come to Finland on May Day yet," Lehtonen wrote. In the Nordic countries, it is customary to draw attention to the day before the actual celebration. The celebration of May Day has also moved to the eve, like Christmas, New Year and Midsummer. Especially since the 1930s, the celebration moved more and more from May Day to the day before it. This was partly influenced by the increasing number of public entertainment events, especially dances, and taking place right on the eve. Sima is one of the most important symbols of Finnish May Day. Sima is enjoyed as a festive drink by the whole family, and it is easy to prepare at home as well. Sparkling wine and champagne have also claimed their place as May Day party drinks. May Day lunch is included in the program of many families.

Vesinokkaeläimet ovat sopeutuneet vesielämään, sillä virtaviivaisen ruumiinrakenteensa sekä räpylöidensä avulla ne pystyvät uimaan vedessä joutuisaa tahtia. Turkki on pehmeä, silkkinen ja väriltään ruskea kuten saukoilla. Turkit olivat haluttuja ja arvokkaita, minkä vuoksi vesinokkaeläimiä metsästettiin niin paljon, että niiden kanta heikkeni selvästi. Nokkasiilit sen sijaan muistuttavat selkäpiikkisensä vuoksi tavallisia siilejä tai pieniä piikkisikoja, mutta eroavat näistä erityisesti nenän rakenteessa. Nokkasiileillä se on pitkä ja ohut, kun taas siileillä se on lyhyenomainen. Piikkisioilla on myös selvästi pidemmät piikit. Nokkasiilien leveät viisivarpaiset raajat ovat erinomaisia hyönteisten <1> Nokkasiilit ("Tachyglossidae") ovat Australiassa ja Uudessa-Guineassa eläviä nokkaeläimiä. Nokkasiilien heimoon kuuluu neljä elossa olevaa lajia. Nokkasiilit ja vesinokkaeläin ovat ainoita munivia nisäkkäitä. Nokkasiileillä on piikikäs selkä ja pitkänomainen nokka. Ne syövät pääasiassa muurahaisia ja termiittejä, mutta myös muita hyönteisiä. Nokkasiilit ovat erakkoluonteisia ja liikkuvat pääosin öiseen aikaan. Nokkasiiliä ("Tachyglossus aculeatus") lukuun ottamatta kaikki nokkasiililajit ovat äärimmäisen uhanalaisia. Nokkasiilien evoluutiosta tiedetään äärimmäisen vähän. Koiraspuolinen nokkasiili ei osallistu poikasten hoitoon millään tavoin, vaan lähtee paikalta heti parittelun jälkeen. Nokkasiileillä on käytössä kirjava joukko erilaisia puolustuskeinoja. split_passages_en: they have five toes on each flipper. The tail of a platypus is very wide and thin, like a beaver, and covered with fur. Platypus have adapted to aquatic life, because with the help of their streamlined body structure and flippers, they are able to swim in the water at a fast pace. The fur is soft, silky and brown in color like otters. The furs were sought after and valuable, which is why platypuses were hunted so much that their population clearly declined. Beaked hedgehogs, on the other hand, resemble ordinary hedgehogs or small porcupines due to their spines, but differ from them especially in the structure of the nose. In beaked hedgehogs it is long and thin, while in hedgehogs it is short. Porcupines also have significantly longer spines. The wide, five-toed limbs of hedgehogs are excellent for catching insects

The beaked hedgehogs ("Tachyglossidae") are beaked animals living in Australia and New Guinea. The hedgehog family includes four living species. Hedgehogs and platypus are the only mammals that lay eggs. Beaked hedgehogs have spiny backs and elongated beaks. They mainly eat ants and termites, but also other insects. Crested hedgehogs are hermits and move mainly at night. There are two extant genera of beaked hedgehogs: "Tachyglossus" and "Zaglossus". In appearance, their species differ from each other, especially in the length of the bill: in the former it is shorter than in the species of the latter genus. In addition to these two, a third genus, "Megalibgwilia", has been identified based on fossil finds. With the exception of the beaked hedgehog ("Tachyglossus aculeatus"), all hedgehog species are extremely endangered. Extremely little is known about the evolution of beaked hedgehogs. The earliest fossil belongs to

it is especially important for chicks not to be exposed to the sun, because their fragile skin cannot withstand it and they die quickly. Hedgehogs are not pack animals. They live their entire lives alone, except for the mating season and a period of about six months after giving birth, which the female spends with her young. The canine beaked hedgehog does not participate in the care of the chicks in any way, but leaves the place immediately after mating. Beaked hedgehogs have a motley set of different means of defense. They can curl up into a ball with the help of muscles in the dermis, just like hedgehogs. The beaked hedgehogs have time to dig a shallow hole for themselves in a minute, leaving only the spiny back on the surface. Hedgehogs are also good climbers, swimmers and runners. Hedgehogs usually do not vocalize in any way,

passage_in_language: <0> Kahvi on kahvipensaan paahdetuista ja jauhetuista pavuista uuttamalla valmistettu, useimmiten kuumana juotava nautintoaine. Kahvi sisältää piristävää alkaloidia, kofeiinia. Kahvia voi valmistaa esimerkiksi pannussa keittämällä, kahvinkeittimessä suodattamalla tai pressopannussa puristamalla. Kahvia voi juoda sellaisenaan eli mustana, mutta siihen lisätään usein esimerkiksi maitoa, kermaa, sokeria tai muita mausteita. Kahvin keksijöinä pidetään arabeja, jotka valmistivat kahvia luultavasti jo 1200-luvun tienoilla Jemenissä. Eurooppaan kahvi tuli 1600-luvulla. Kahvia tuotetaan runsaasti Keski- ja Etelä-Amerikassa, kuten Brasiliassa, Kolumbiassa ja Guatemalassa. Muita merkittäviä kahvintuottajamaita ovat esimerkiksi Vietnam, Etiopia ja Indonesia. Suurin kahvintuottajamaa Brasilia tuottaa noin kolmasosan maailman kahvista. Yleisimmin viljeltyjä kahvilajeja ovat arabiankahvi ja kongonkahvi, joista arabiankahvia pidetään <1> paahdetaan kevyesti enintään vuorokautta ennen cuppingia ja jauhetaan karkeaksi juuri ennen maistelua. Kuppiin annostellaan 7–8 grammaa kahvia ja 1,5 desilitraa 93–95-asteista vettä. Kahvin annetaan tekeytyä 3–5 minuuttia. Sen jälkeen sitä haistetaan ja maistetaan lusikalla, ja sen ominaisuuksia vertaillaan muihin laatuihin. Myös pavun ulkomuoto arvioidaan. Suomessa juodaan kahvia asukasta kohti eniten maailmassa. Vuonna 2011 suomalainen kulutti raakakahvia 12,2 kilogrammaa, mikä on paahdettuna kahvina 10 kg. Seuraavaksi eniten raakakahvia asukasta kohti kulutettiin muissa Pohjoismaissa: Norjassa 8,9 kg, Ruotsissa 7,4 kg ja Tanskassa 7,4 kg. Italian kulutus on 5,8 kg asukasta kohti. Suosituimmat kahvien tuotemerkit Suomessa vuonna 2004 olivat Juhla Mokka, Kulta Katriina, <2> 800:aan. Myös pavun väri vaihtuu vihreästä ruskeaksi. Kahvilla on neljä tai viisi paahtoastetta. Paahtoajan pituudesta ja paahtolämpötilasta riippuen kahvista tulee paahtoasteeltaan joko vaaleaa, keskipaahtoista, tummaa tai erittäin tummaa. Vaaleapaahtoinen kahvi on maultaan tummapaahtoista hapokkaampaa, ja tummempi paahto puolestaan tekee mausta pehmeämmän. Kaupasta ostettavat kahvit ovat yleensä kahvisekoituksia, jotka on valmistettu yhteispaahtona tai erillispaahtona. Yhteispaahdossa raakakahvipavut sekoitetaan ennen paahtoprosessia, ja erillispaahdossa jokainen raakakahvilaji paahdetaan erikseen ja sekoitetaan vasta paahdon jälkeen. Vuoteen 1926 saakka valtaosa Suomessa myydystä kahvista myös paahdettiin itse. Vuonna 2013 Suomessa oli toistakymmentä paahtimoa, joista valtaosa oli aloittanut viime vuosien aikana. Kahvipavut jauhetaan ennen kahvin valmistusta. Jauhatusaste riippuu kahvin <3> Kahvivero on Suomessa vuosina 1939–1942 ja 1948–1954 käytössä ollut valmistevero, jota paahtimon tuli maksaa paahdetusta kahvista valtiolle. Kalenterikuukauden aikana kauppaan toimitetusta kahvista oli maksettava vero lääninrahastoon viimeistään seuraavan kuukauden 15. päivänä. Vuosina 1948–1954 vero tuli maksaa leima- ja valmisteverokonttorin postisiirtotilille 45 vuorokauden kuluessa kuukauden päättymisestä. Ulkomaille viety kahvi oli verosta vapaata. Valmisteverolain noudattamista valvoi leima- ja valmisteverokonttori. Paahtimon oli kiinnitettävä kahvipakkaukseen leima- ja valmisteverokonttorin hyväksymä veronauha, jossa oli merkittynä kahvin laatu ja määrä, paahtimon nimi ja kotipaikka sekä veron määrä. Veronauha oli kiinnitettävä pakkaukseen siten, että se katkesi pakkausta avattaessa. Veroa maksettiin säännöstelyn ulkopuolella myytävästä kahvista. Kahviveron tuotto oli 1941
split_passages_en: Coffee is a pleasure substance made by extracting the roasted and ground beans of the coffee bush, usually drunk hot. Coffee contains a stimulating alkaloid, caffeine. Coffee can be prepared, for example, by boiling in a pan, filtering in a coffee maker or pressing in a pressure cooker. You can drink coffee as it is, i.e. black, but milk, cream, sugar or other spices are often added to it. Arabs are considered to be the inventors of coffee, who probably made coffee around the 13th century in Yemen. Coffee came to Europe in the 17th century. Coffee is produced in abundance in Central and South America, such as Brazil, Colombia and Guatemala. Other important coffee-producing countries are, for example, Vietnam, Ethiopia and Indonesia. Brazil, the largest coffee-producing country, produces about a third of the world's coffee. The most commonly cultivated coffee species are Arabica coffee and Congo coffee, from which Arabica coffee is considered

lightly roasted no more than a day before cupping and coarsely ground just before tasting. 7–8 grams of coffee and 1.5 deciliters of 93–95 degree water are dosed into the cup. Let the coffee brew for 3–5 minutes. After that, it is smelled and tasted with a spoon, and its properties are compared to other qualities. The appearance of the bean is also evaluated. Finland drinks the most coffee per inhabitant in the world. In 2011, a Finn consumed 12.2 kilograms of raw coffee, which is 10 kg of roasted coffee. Next, the most raw coffee per inhabitant was consumed in the other Nordic countries: 8.9 kg in Norway, 7.4 kg in Sweden and 7.4 kg in Denmark. Italy's consumption is 5.8 kg per inhabitant. The most popular coffee brands in Finland in 2004 were Juhla Mokka, Kulta Katriina,

to 800. The color of the bean also changes from green to brown. Coffee has four or five degrees of roast. Depending on the length of the roasting time and the roasting temperature, the coffee will be light, medium, dark or very dark. Light-roasted coffee has a more acidic taste than dark-roasted coffee, and a darker roast, on the other hand, makes the taste softer. The coffees you buy in the store are usually coffee blends that are made as a joint roast or a separate roast. In joint roasting, raw coffee beans are mixed before the roasting process, and in separate roasting, each type of raw coffee is roasted separately and mixed only after roasting. Until 1926, the vast majority of coffee sold in Finland was also roasted in-house. In 2013, there were twenty roasters in Finland, the vast majority of which had started in the last few years. Coffee beans are ground before coffee is made. The degree of grinding depends on the coffee

The coffee tax is an excise tax used in Finland between 1939–1942 and 1948–1954, which the roaster had to pay to the state for roasted coffee. The tax for the coffee delivered to the store during the calendar month had to be paid to the county fund no later than the 15th of the following month. In the years 1948–1954, the tax had to be paid to the stamp and excise office's postal transfer account within 45 days of the end of the month. Coffee exported abroad was tax-free. Compliance with the Excise Tax Act was monitored by the Stamp and Excise Tax Office. The roaster had to attach a tax strip approved by the stamp and excise tax office to the coffee package, which indicated the quality and quantity of the coffee, the roaster's name and domicile, and the tax amount. The tax strip had to be attached to the package in such a way that it broke when the package was opened. The tax was paid for coffee sold outside the regulation. The income from the coffee tax was 1941

passage_in_language: <0> Haima () on selkärankaisilla tavattava ruoansulatusrauhanen, joka sijaitsee vatsaontelossa. Se on punertava ja painaa alle sata grammaa. Haiman paksumpi pää sijaitsee oikealla puolella pohjukaissuolen mutkassa ja ohuempi pää lähellä pernan porttia. Haima on sekä avorauhanen että umpirauhanen. Haiman eksokriininen eli avoeritteinen osa, joka on noin 98 prosenttia koko haimasta, erittää suoleen ruoansulatusnesteitä. Eksokriinisen osan tiehyet liittyvät yhteen haimatiehyeksi, joka vie haiman eritteen pohjukaissuoleen. Haimatiehyellä ja sapenjohtimella voi olla lyhyt yhteinen loppuosa, joka laskee ison pohjukaissuolinystyn eli papilla Vaterin kohdalle. Haimalla on usein myös toinen tiehyt, joka laskee hieman ylemmäs pieneen pohjukaissuolinystyyn. Haimasta erittyy vuorokaudessa noin puolitoista litraa "haimanestettä". Neste koostuu <1> silloin, kun nimenomaan hai ei ole tavoiteltu laji: haikaloja päätyy sivusaaliiksi. Kun hai takertuu verkkoon eikä pysty liikkumaan, se hukkuu, koska vesi ei pääse virtaamaan sen kidusten läpi. Haipopulaatioiden määrän arviointi on vaikeaa salakalastuksen vuoksi sekä siksi, että sivusaaliiksi jääneistä haista ei vaivauduta ilmoittamaan. Kalastuksen uhriksi joutuu jatkuvasti haita, jotka eivät ole saavuttaneet vielä sukukypsyyttä, minkä seurauksena vesistä katoaa myös seuraavia haisukupolvia. Jättiläishai kasvaa hitaasti ja lisääntyy satunnaisesti. Tällaisen lajin kanta on erityisen haavoittuvainen. Valtamerten ekosysteemi muuttuu, kun ravintoketjusta puuttuu joku linkki. Kun haiden määrä vähenee, niiden saaliiksi yleensä joutuvien kalojen määrä kasvaa liiaksi ja ne taas metsästävät runsaasti keskikoisia <2> Joka vuosi yli 100 miljoonaa haita kuolee kalaverkkoihin ja laivan potkureihin jääneinä. Niitä myös kalastetaan ruuaksi; esimerkiksi Aasiassa valmistetaan haineväkeittoa, jota varten pyydystettävistä haista osasta käytetään koko hai, mutta joskus hai nostetaan laivaan, siltä katkaistaan evät ja se heitetään elävänä takaisin mereen. Tällöin hai uppoaa merenpohjaan, jossa se kuolee kituen. Hain liha on ihmiselle myrkyllistä, sillä se pitää sisällään suuria määriä metyylielohopeaa. Monien hailajien kanta on muuttunut vaarantuneeksi tai erittäin uhanalaiseksi ihmisen toimien vuoksi. Laiton salakalastus uhkaa haikantoja, sillä evistä saatetaan maksaa jopa 1 100 dollaria kilolta. Uhanalaisimpia ovat sillihai, jättiläishai, valkopilkkahai, vasarahai ja isovasarahai. Kalastus yleensäkin uhkaa haita myös <3> tapauksessa. Elinsiirron yhteydessä yhä elävät kudokset on poistettava nopeasti kuolleesta isännästä, ennen kuin ne kuolevat puutteellisten elintoimintojen takia. Toisaalta organismin yksittäiset solut tai jopa elimet voivat kuolla, mutta organismi voi jäädä eloon. Monet yksittäiset solut elävät vain lyhyen aikaa, joten suurin osa organismin soluista uusiutuu jatkuvasti. Lääketieteessä kuolema tarkoittaa elimistön toimintojen pysyvää lakkaamista. Kuolinhetki voidaan määritellä verenkierron ja hengityksen loppumisena (sydänkuolema, kliininen kuolema) tai aivojen toiminnan loppumisena (aivokuolema). split_passages_en: Command & Conquer is a series of light real-time strategy games developed and published by Westwood Studios. The game marked the final breakthrough of the genre it represented. The first representative of the genre was "Dune 2" made by the same authors from 1992. Before the release of "Command & Conquer", "Warcraft" which borrowed the idea from the game "Dune 2" had already appeared, which was the second representative of the genre. In 1998, Electronic Arts bought Westwood and later closed it down in 2003. Since then, the games have been developed and published by EA Los Angeles, a game house owned by Electronic Arts. The Command & Conquer game series is the world's most successful and best-selling strategy game series. More than 35 million games have already been sold worldwide. Lidl is a German supermarket chain. The founder of the network is Dieter Schwartz. The business was started by his father in 1930, who within 10 years turned the company into a significant enterprise in the wholesale food market. In 1977, after the death of his father, the company was taken over by his son Dieter Schwartz. West Kazakhstan Region (, ) is an administrative region on the western border of Kazakhstan, partly in Europe, partly in Asia. The region is bordered in the east by the Aqtöbe region, in the south by the Atıraw region, and elsewhere by Russia. The region has an estimated 636,875 inhabitants (in 2016) and its area is 151,300 square kilometers. The Ural River flows through the area. Administratively, the region is divided into 12 districts. Blade is a horror/action film that premiered in 1998. The film is directed by Stephen Norrington and stars Wesley Snipes and Stephen Dorff. The film received sequels "Blade II" and "". A hip hop-focused album has been released from the film's music. The movie is about Blade, who is half human and half vampire, but still hunts other vampires. Blade is only used to weak vampires, but he meets the lord of the vampires, Deacon Frost, whom Blade has to kill. The Blade movies are based on the Marvel Comics character Blade. Blade is played in the films by Wesley Snipes and the first film was released in 1998, the second in 2002 and the third in 2004. They were written by David S. Goyer, Marv Wolfman, and Gene Colan and directed by Stephen Norrington, Guillermo del Toro and David S. Goyer, in that order. The films were distributed by New Line Cinema. The character was created in 1973 by Marvel Comics writer Marv Wolfman and artist Gene Colan as a minor character in the 70s comic book "Tomb of Dracula". In the series, Blade's mother is bitten by a vampire just as she is about to give birth to Blade, therefore Blade is born

Blade Runner is an American neo-noir science fiction film that premiered in 1982 and was directed by Ridley Scott. It stars Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Edward James Olmos. The script written by Hampton Fancher and David Peoples is loosely based on Philip K. Dick's novel "The Bounty Hunter" from 1968. The film is set in a dystopian Los Angeles in 2019 and depicts a future where the influential Tyrell company has built synthetic humans, or replicants, to work in space colonies. When a group of replicants led by Roy Batty (Hauer) escapes back to Earth, overworked cop Rick Deckard (Ford) reluctantly accepts the mission to track them down as one last assignment. During his investigation, Deckard meets an advanced replicant, Rachael (Young), who makes him question himself

Blade (real name Eric Brooks) is a fictional comic book character from Marvel Comics. The character was created by Marvin A. "Marv" Wolfman and Gene Cola in the 1973 Tomb of Dracula magazine as an antagonist to the prince of vampires. Blade entered the magazine very early on as a side character, and has since appeared in many of his own adventures. The 1998 Blade movie featured some of the characters from the comic and starred Wesley Snipes. The film has received two sequels. In 2006, "Blade: The Series" aired, starring Sticky Fingaz after Snipes turned down the role. The series produced by Spike TV was only produced for one season. Blade stood out from other comic book heroes because of his direct and sometimes rude way of speaking. The dialogue was meant to reflect the 1970s

The first Mithridate war was fought in 89 BC. – 85 BC between the Roman Republic and the Kingdom of Pontus. It began when Mithridates VI, king of Pontus, began to expand his empire to the coasts of the Black Sea and Asia Minor. This was the beginning of a years-long power struggle between Pontus and the other kingdoms of Asia Minor, in which the Romans also got involved. Finally, the relationship between Pontus and Rome escalated into a full-scale war in 89 BC. Mithridates' forces quickly defeated the armies of the Romans and their allies and almost completely conquered Asia Minor except for a few cities. Mithridates then invaded Greece at the request of the anti-Roman people in Athens.
